intro: Chrysodium serratifolium, commonly known as the serrated leaf chrysodium, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant features narrow, serrated leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing yellow to orange inflorescences that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chrysodium serratifolium is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand seasonal droughts.
